p: Medicinal plants contain bioactive organic chemical compounds often referred to as phytochemicals, which play a defensive role against major chronic diseases in both host-metabolic or genetic dysfunctional disease and infectious disease, and found in grains, vegetables, fruits, and other plant products [ 13â€“ 16]. Phytochemicals perform intermediary metabolic activities, and they function as primary metabolites such as fats and sugars found in all plants, while secondary metabolites are found in a smaller range of plants and provide specialized functions.
